pullrequest.title: Team Tang fix the docker bug.

content.raw:
I tested it on our side and it was work.

Here is the way we test:

Open two terminal to run our docker.

```
**First terminal:**
```

`$ source environment.sh`

`$ docker run -it --entrypoint "bin/bash" --name "tang" tychien/ntu_vrx_dockertest:latest`

`$ roslaunch vrx_gazebo vrx.launch world:=/home/tang/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/worlds/phase2_dock0.world urdf:=/home/tang/ntu_vrx/ntu_wamv/ntu_wamv.urdf`

```
**Second terminal:**
```

`$ docker exec -it tang /bin/bash`

`$ source environment.sh`

`$ cd /home/tang/ntu_vrx`

`$ ./docker_start.py`

docker\_start.py can auto detect the task name.

Cause the “./prepare\_task\_trials.bash” dock can only generate “dock 0~2” It can't generate the “phase2\_dock 0~5” and the task name of “dock 0~2” are not “scan“.

So we didn’t test it by entry point.

We are trying our best to solve it. If there is any suggestion please tell us.

Thanks.
content.html:
I tested it on our side and it was work.

Here is the way we test:

Open two terminal to run our docker.

**First terminal:**

$ source environment.sh

$ docker run -it --entrypoint "bin/bash" --name "tang" tychien/ntu_vrx_dockertest:latest

$ roslaunch vrx_gazebo vrx.launch world:=/home/tang/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/worlds/phase2_dock0.world urdf:=/home/tang/ntu_vrx/ntu_wamv/ntu_wamv.urdf

**Second terminal:**

$ docker exec -it tang /bin/bash

$ source environment.sh

$ cd /home/tang/ntu_vrx

$ ./docker_start.py

docker_start.py can auto detect the task name.

Cause the “./prepare_task_trials.bash” dock can only generate “dock 0~2” It can't generate the “phase2_dock 0~5” and the task name of “dock 0~2” are not “scan“.

So we didn’t test it by entry point.

We are trying our best to solve it. If there is any suggestion please tell us.

Thanks.
